newsitem.title: THAILAND: Three Chinese tourists die in Thai road crash.
newsitem.headline: Three Chinese tourists die in Thai road crash.

text.p: Four people, including three Chinese tourists, were killed when their van collided head-on with a truck in southern Thailand at the weekend, police said on Monday.
Police said the van carrying nine Chinese tourists crashed into the truck on Saturday night in Phang-nga province, some 850 km (520 miles) south of Bangkok.

Police identified the dead as Cheng Ergin, 51, director general of the information department of China's Science and Technology Institute, his daughter Cheng Hui, 23, and Zhang Chao, the 50-year-old information chief of the institute.
Somsiri Bunnag, a Thai student at Beijing University who served as the group's tour guide, was also killed. Five other passengers were injured, police said.
No other details were immediately available.
